description: Stats definitions for runtime risk engine - populated by bot service every 60 seconds
purpose: This file documents the statistical measures used by the orchestrator's risk engine. The actual values are written to stats.json by your bot/service.

realizedVol.description: Exponentially Weighted Moving Average (EWMA) of 1-minute log-return standard deviation
realizedVol.calculation: EWMA of std(log(close_t / close_{t-1})) over 1-minute bars
realizedVol.purpose: Measures recent market volatility for adaptive position sizing

interpretation.low: < 0.4 = Low volatility, may increase position size

spreadZ.description: Z-score of current spread versus 60-minute rolling mean and standard deviation
spreadZ.purpose: Detects abnormal spread widening (low liquidity or high volatility events)

policyThresholds.beta: 0.3 global, varies by symbol (EURUSD: 0.15, XAUUSD: 0.35, US30: 0.25)

notes: Do NOT manually edit stats.json - it is auto-generated by the bot
This README.json is for human reference only
The orchestrator reads stats.json to compute adaptive risk.multiplier
See policy.json for how these stats affect risk calculations
